DOCTRAIN.TITLE: Debian project
DOCTRAIN.BODY: One patient had no sequelae. Implications for management are considered. Implications for management are considered. Thirty children were followed prospectively. Three patients suffered cerebral infarctions. Muscle paralysis confirms this observation. Brain stem involvement is infrequent. No coagulation abnormalities were documented. No effective therapy is known. More reliable bone-graft position resulted. No neuroanatomic lesions were noted. They were all developmentally retarded. The likely aetiology is discussed. Eleven patients had bilateral findings. Serology for HIV was positive. Plasma T4 levels remained unchanged. Possible pathogenic implications are discussed. Ectopic intracranial retinoblastomas are rare.
